summary: This document is an addendum to the Non-Prosecution Agreement in the Jeffrey Epstein investigation, clarifying provisions regarding the selection and payment of an attorney representative for victims. It outlines Epstein's agreement to pay the attorney's fees under certain conditions and includes signatures from key parties.

events.title: Signing of Addendum to Non-Prosecution Agreement
events.description: The addendum clarifying provisions of the Non-Prosecution Agreement is signed by U.S. Attorney R. Alexander Acosta, Jeffrey Epstein, and his attorneys Gerald Lefcourt and Lilly Ann Sanchez.

keyFacts: The addendum clarifies that the U.S. can assign an independent third-party to select an attorney representative for victims, with Epstein's counsel having good faith approval rights.

Epstein agrees to pay the hourly rates of the attorney representative selected, but this obligation ceases if the attorney files contested litigation against him under statutes like 18 U.S.C. ยง 2255.
The document is signed by U.S. Attorney R. Alexander Acosta, indicating high-level DOJ approval of the agreement modifications.
The addendum is part of the controversial 2007 Non-Prosecution Agreement that granted Epstein federal immunity for sex crimes.
